post.summary: This endpoint is used to retrieve a resident's property owned Id, unit Id and account Id
post.description: Retrieves property owned records by passing the property code, the resident's first and last name plus their unit number. All these data points are required and must be exact matches for record(s) to be found.

200.description: The search was successful and found at least 1 matching record.

400.description: Invalid input, object invalid, missing required field

get.summary: This endpoint is used to retrieve all residents for the property code with their unit number, first name and last name being returned
get.description: Retrieves property owned records by passing the property code, property code must be passed .

400.description: Invalid input, object invalid, missing required field

get.summary: This endpoint is used to retrieve the supported picklist values based on the SFDC RecordType.
get.description: Use this resource to get the values for all the picklist fields of the HOME_Requests record type. This resource is especially useful for getting category and status picklist values. These picklist values do not change often as such it is recommended that this result be cached to reduce the number of API request per day. Supported Record Types: 1. HOME_Requests 2. Home_Instructions

parameters.name: recordType
parameters.description: The SFDC Record Type API name

get.summary: Retrieve resident information by property Owned Id
get.description:
Retrieves information by property owned Id
### Resident Detail
* Returns the resident's personal information like preferred email, phone, type of resident and a link to the resident's profile photo 
�
 * Response Node Key: 'Resident'
### Common area bookings
* Returns bookings that are Approved or Requested 
�
 * Bookings are returned that happened in the last 45 days 
�
 * Bookings that are happening in the next year(365 days) are returned 
�
 * Response Node Key: 'Common_Area_Bookings'
### Requests
* Returns Home requests and Home instructions that are visible to the resident 
�
 * Requests are returned that happened in the last 45 days 
�
 * Requests that are happening in the next year(365 days) are returned 
�
 * Response Node Key: 'Requests'
### Notification Preference
* Returns the resident's notification preference as a boolean flag indicating what types of request the resident wants to be notified about 
�
 * Returns the type of notification the resident wants to receives. Currently only Email is supported. 
�
 * Response Node Key: 'Notification_Preference' 
�

### Pets
* Returns a list of the pets that are assigned to the resident 
�
 * Each pet record has the pets details like name, category, notes and insuranc dates. Response Node Key: 'Pet__c' 
�
 * Each pet record has a single profile photo. Response Node Key: 'profilePhoto' 
�
 * Each pet record has a little for supporting attachments (ie. insurance documents). Respone Node Key: 'attachments' 
�
 * Response Node Key: 'Pets' 
�

### Vehicles Owned
* Returns a list of vehicles owned assigned to the resident 
�
 * Each Vehicle record has details such as Make, Vehicle Type, Model. 
�
 * Inside Vehicles_Owned there is a Node Key: 'profilePhoto' this will store the vehicles image. 
�
 * There is also a Node Key: 'Vehicle_Drivers' that stores all the drivers assigned to the vehicle along with their photo 
�
 * Response Node Key: 'Vehicles_Owned' 
�
 * Ignore Resident_Connections__r node inside Vehicles_Owned Node 
�
 * Vehicle_Drivers will store the Driver photo and Name if there is no photo it will be null 
�

### Deprecating Use: /v1/resi/properties-owned/{propertyOwnedId}/
### Ignore Resident_Connections__r node inside Vehicles_Owned Node
Vehicle_Drivers will store the Driver photo and Name if there is no photo it will be null

get.summary: Retrieve common areas that are viewable to residents by property owned Id
get.description:
This API will return all the common areas that are visible to residents by property Owned Id

The common areas will be filtered by the property and property owned location which are retrieved from the property owned

get.summary: Retrieve common areas that are viewable to residents by property id
get.description:
This API will return all the common areas that are visible to residents by property Id
A location Id can also be passed in the query to filter by property and location. Location Id is optional
If only a property Id is passed, the locations of the common areas are ignored

get.summary: Get requests (Home Instructions, Home Requests) based on unit record Id.
get.description:
This API will return the Home owner association details matched to the property owned id passed through.
### Home_Owner_Association_Members
* Returns list of Home owner association members that are active 
�

get.summary: Retrieve Common area bookings for a specified date range
get.description:
This API will return all the common area bookings for the specified dates.
Each booking will return the start time, end time, property owned id and the date it is booked on.
### Example
* startDate 10/05/2019 
�
 * The Start date will begin on 10/05/2019 00:00:00 
�
 * endDate 10/05/2019 
�
 * The end date will be until 10/05/2019 23:59:59

get.summary: Retrieves the file's content as Base64 Binary stream for the file id passed in.
get.description:
The file's content is only available to the API after one of the other API endpoints like /v1/resi/properties-owned/{propertyOwnedId}/ has returned the file detail.

(File Detail)  All files will be represented with the following 4 attributes:
1. **url**: This is the endpoint for retrieving the file's content (You will used this value to call this API).
2. **size**: the number of bytes
3. **name**: the name of the file in Salesforce
4. **extension**: the file's extension type

There is an expiration period which is currently set to 60 minutes; however, this is adjustable by Salesforce System admins as needed. If you try to access this endpoint to retrieve the file's content after the expiration period, you will receive an error. The expiration period is refreshed each time you retrieve the main record which the file is associated with. So, the expiration period is X minutes from the last time you retrieved the file's related record.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description:
This is the id of the file to retrieve. This id will be included in the relative path detail ('url') from a previous endpoint call.
## For example:
* If you are working with a resident's profile photo, you will receive the path needed to make this call from the Resident.profilePhoto.url node of the /v1/resi/properties-owned/{propertyOwnedId}/ endpoint.
* If you are working with an attachment from a request, you will recieve the path needed to make this call from the Requests[x].attachments[x].url node of the /v1/resi/properties-owned/{propertyOwnedId}/ endpoint.

200.description: Successful operation - results in binary dump of the file's content

get.summary: Retrieve documents that are viewable to residents by property owned Id
get.description:
This API will return all the unit documents, resident documents and the property wide documents that are visible to residents by property Owned Id

Each document record will have the category, type of document and the following 4 attributes about the file:
1. **url**: This is the endpoint for retrieving the file's content (You will used this value to call the file retrieve API).
2. **size**: the number of bytes
3. **name**: the name of the file in Salesforce
4. **extension**: the file's extension type


### Unit Documents
* Returns documents which are assigned to the resident's (based on the property owned id passed in) unit and has visible to resident set to true 
�
 * Response Node Key: 'Unit_Documents'
### Resident Documents
* Returns documents which are assigned specifically to the resident (based on the property owned id passed in) and has visible to resident set to true 
�
 * Response Node Key: 'Resident_Documents'

This API is used to create a common area

### Required fields

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description: Contains Common Area Information for the case to be created

400.description: Invalid input, object invalid, missing required field

post.description:
This endpoint is used to add or replace an existing 'profile' photo for the Salesforce record ID that is passed in. If there is an existing profile photo the previous version is deleted from Salesforce.
Currently the following objects support 'profile' photo uploads:
1. Account (Resident)
2. Pet__c
3. Vehicle__c

Currently these are the supported file extenstions: png and jpg

The maximum file size is 5 MB, recommended size is less than 3 MB.

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description: Contains the fileUpload object (converted binary into base64)

400.description: Invalid input, object invalid, missing required field

404.description: Record not OR Profile Photo upload not supported

post.description:
This endpoint is used to add a file to the Salesforce record ID that is passed in.
Currently the following objects support attachment uploads:
1. Pet__c
2. Case (HOME Requests / HOME Instructions)

The maximum file size is 5 MB, recommended size is less than 3 MB.

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description: Contains the fileUpload object (converted binary into base64)

400.description: Invalid input, object invalid, missing required field

404.description: Record not OR attachment upload not supported

post.summary: Creates a notification preference for the resident
post.description:
This endpoint is used to create a new notification preference for a resident. Currently the only notification type supported in Email. There are several flags to enroll the resident into notification for different category of requests. If the flag is set to 'True' the resident will be emailed when when any request of that category type enters into the status for email send.
Currently the supported types are:
1. Common_Area_Bookings__c (Common Area Bookings)
2. Grocery_items__c (Grocery)
3. Laundry_Dry_Cleaning__c (Laundry and Dry Cleaning)
4. Pick_up__c (Pick up)
5. Vehicle_Services__c (Vehicle Services)
6. Unit_Access__c (Unit Access)
7. Florists_Plants__c (Florists and Plants)
8. Keys__c (Keys)
9. Packages_and_Deliveries__c (Packages and Deliveries)
10. Resident_Pick_ups__c (Resident Pick Ups)
11. Resident_Purchase_and_Errands__c (Resident Purchase and Errands)

Note: A resident can only have 1 notification preference per unit. If changes are needed, use to PATCH endpoint (/v1/resi/notification-preference/) to update the existing record. If you try to add a new notification and one already exists you will be presented with the following error 'A notification already exists for this resident's property owned record'

Note: A resident must have a preferred email address set on their property owned record as a prerequisite for a notification preference addition. If the email is not present on the property owned record wou will be presented with the following error 'A email address is required on the property owned record for this resident to subscribe to Email notifications.';

Required Fields: Property_Owned__c and Notify_By__c. Set Notify_By__c to Email as this is currently the only supported type.

201.description: This will indicate that the new notification was successfully created.

400.description: Invalid input, object invalid, missing required field, or a notification already exists for the property owned record

patch.summary: Update an existing notification preference for the resident
patch.description:
This endpoint is used to update an existig notification preference for a resident. Currently the only notification type supported in Email. There are several flags to enroll the resident into notification for different category of requests. If the flag is set to 'True' the resident will be emailed when when any request of that category type enters into the status for email send.
Currently the supported types are:
1. Common_Area_Bookings__c (Common Area Bookings)
2. Grocery_items__c (Grocery)
3. Laundry_Dry_Cleaning__c (Laundry and Dry Cleaning)
4. Pick_up__c (Pick up)
5. Vehicle_Services__c (Vehicle Services)
6. Unit_Access__c (Unit Access)
7. Florists_Plants__c (Florists and Plants)
8. Keys__c (Keys)
9. Packages_and_Deliveries__c (Packages and Deliveries)
10. Resident_Pick_ups__c (Resident Pick Ups)
11. Resident_Purchase_and_Errands__c (Resident Purchase and Errands)

Note: A resident must have a preferred email address set on their property owned record as a prerequisite for a notification preference addition. If the email is not present on the property owned record wou will be presented with the following error 'A email address is required on the property owned record for this resident to subscribe to Email notifications.';

Required Fields: Id

400.description: Invalid input, object invalid, missing required field, or a notification already exists for the property owned record

delete.summary: Deletes the file based on the file id passed in.
delete.description:
The file's id is only available to the API after one of the other API endpoints like /v1/resi/properties-owned/{propertyOwnedId}/ has returned the file detail.

(File Detail)  All files will be represented with the following 4 attributes:
1. **url**: This is the endpoint for retrieving the file's content (You will used this value to call this API).
2. **size**: the number of bytes
3. **name**: the name of the file in Salesforce
4. **extension**: the file's extension type

There is an expiration period which is currently set to 60 minutes; however, this is adjustable by Salesforce System admins as needed. If you try to access this endpoint to delete the file after the expiration period, you will receive an error. The expiration period is refreshed each time you retrieve the main record which the file is associated with. So, the expiration period is X minutes from the last time you retrieved the file's related record.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description:
This is the id of the file to delete. This id will be included in the relative path detail ('url') from a previous endpoint call.
## For example:
* If you are working with a resident's profile photo, you will receive the path needed to make this call from the Resident.profilePhoto.url node of the /v1/resi/properties-owned/{propertyOwnedId}/ endpoint.
* If you are working with an attachment from a request, you will recieve the path needed to make this call from the Requests[x].attachments[x].url node of the /v1/resi/properties-owned/{propertyOwnedId}/ endpoint.

404.description: Record not found or Expired or User does not have delete rights

post.summary: Create a new RESI requesst (Home Instruction, Home Requests)
post.description:
Create a new request. Only Home Instruction/Request record types are supported.
### RecordType name
1. Home Instructions 
�
 2. Home Requests 
�

### Required fields for Home Instructions-
* Description 
�
 * Category__c 
�
 * Property_lkp__c 
�
 * Unit__c 
�
 * Property_Owned__c 
�
 * AccountId
### Required fields for Home Request
* Property_lkp__c 
�
 * Unit__c 
�
 * AccountId
Case_Origin__c with Am passed is required for both record types
### Digital Platform
When Creating a Home request or Home instruction through the mobile app the following fields are required in the body as well
* Created_By_Digital_Platform_User__c (User from the app that created the request) 
�
 * Visible_to_Residents__c: true (When the resident should be able to view it on the app) 
�

### Supported Lookup Fields
* AccountId (Golden Id) 
�
 * Currency__c (Currency Code) 
�
 * RecordTypeId (Sub Request DeveloperName) 
�
 * Stay_Information__c (Reservation Number) 
�
 * Vendor__c (Vendor External Id)

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description: Contains the Case object to be created and the optional map of lookup-name/alternate-Id pairs

patch.summary: Update a request (Home Instruction, Home Requests)
patch.description:
Update case information. Only record types Home Instructions & Home Requests are supported. RecordType names
* Home Instructions  
�
 * Home Requests 
�

### Digital Platform
When Updating a Home request or Home instruction through the mobile app the following fields are required in the body as well
* Last_Modified_By_Digital_Platform_User__c (App user who is modifying an existing Request) 
�
 * Digital_Platform_User_Last_Modified_Date__c (Date Request is modified by the app user) 
�

Required fields for Home Instructions- Description, Category__c, Property_lkp__c ,Unit__c, Property_Owned__c
Required fields for Home Request- Property_lkp__c, Unit__c
If the caller is unable to populate any required lookup with proper Salesforce record Id, populate **mappings** with lookup-name/alternate-Id pair(s) for server-side resolution. 
�
 If Id field of the request object isn't populated, the API will attempt to resolve it using CaseNumber.
### Supported Lookup Fields
* AccountId (Golden Id) 
�
 * Currency__c (Currency Code) 
�
 * Id (Case Number) 
�
 * RecordTypeId (Sub Request DeveloperName) 
�
 * Stay_Information__c (Reservation Number) 
�
 * Vendor__c (Vendor External Id)

parameters.name: Body
parameters.description: Contains the Case object to be updated and the optional map of lookup-name/alternate-Id pairs

relatedSFDCRecordId.description: The record id the file should be attached to in Salesforce.

pathOnClient.description: The complete path of the document, this field is used to determine the FileType. Specify a complete path including the path extension.

base64Content.description: The content or body of the document.

Role__c.description: This is the home owner association members role in the HOA

Account_Name__c.description: This is the name of the home owner association member

Id.description: Id of the home owner association member record

example.Name: AM-1002
example.Property__c.Name: Four Seasons Hotel Casa Medina Bogota

Id.description: This is the property owned Salesforce record ID.

Unit__c.description: This is the unit Salesforce record ID

Contact__c.description: This is the account (resident) Salesforce record ID

Property__c.description: This is the property Salesforce record ID

label.description: The displayable value of the picklist to use in UI.

value.description: The value of the picklist to use in the API.

validFor.description: If the picklist is a dependent picklist, the property contains a list of the controlling value indexes for which this value is valid. If the picklist is an independent picklist, the list is empty.

attributes.description: This property might contain a nested response body to help consumers understand the meaning of the picklist value.

controllerValues.description: If the picklist is dependent, this property is a map of its immediate controlling field's picklist values to their indexes. If the controlling field is a picklist, the String is the picklist value and the integer is the value's index. If the controlling field is a checkbox, the values in the map are 'false': 0 and 'true': 1. If the picklist is independent, the map is empty.

defaultValue.description: The default value for the picklist, or null if there isn't one.

values.description: A list of values for this object, record type, field combination.

picklistFieldValues.description: A map of field names to Picklist Values response bodies. This map contains all the picklist values for all the picklists of a specified record type, including dependent picklists. If a field isn't a picklist, it isn't represented in the map.

firstName.description: This is the residents first name

lastName.description: This is the residents last name

unitNumber.description: This is the residents unit number

name.description: This is the resident's full name or the name of a company account record
